thread.title: Crimson just perfect against Lafayette
thread.title_full: Crimson just perfect against Lafayette | Boston Herald

author: Herald Staff
title: Crimson just perfect against Lafayette
text:
Harvard running back Paul Stanton ran for two touchdowns as the Crimson remained undefeated with a one-sided nonconference win over Lafayette, 42-0, yesterday in Easton, Pa.
Stanton had 123 yards on 18 carries for the Crimson (5-0).
Scott Hosch threw for 272 yards and a scoring pass to Ben Braunecker who finished with 123 yards receiving. Hosch also ran for a score. Harvard finished with 500 yards in offense while the defense held Lafayette to just 197 total yards.
Stanton rushed for a pair of touchdowns in the first half and Hosch added a third, sending Harvard into the break leading 21-0.
Hosch hit Braunecker for a 32-yard score midway through the third quarter and Seitu Smith took it in from 6 yards to give the Crimson a 35-0 advantage. Noah Reimers 4-yard touchdown run early in the fourth sealed the Harvard win.
Drew Reed threw for 215 yards for the Leopards (1-6).
Dartmouth 34, Central Conn. State 7 — Dalyn Williams threw three touchdown passes, Ryder Stone ran for two scores and the Big Green (5-0) beat the Blue Devils (2-5) in a nonleague game in New Britain, Conn.
Dartmouth scored 20 straight points in the second half on the way to its eighth straight victory.
Williams was 23-of-33 for 249 yards and one interception for Dartmouth, with TD passes of 44-yards to Jon Marc Carrier to open the scoring and 8 and 3 yards to Cameron Skaff. Victor Williams had seven catches for 95 yards. Stone gained 49 yards on 13 carries with two short TD runs.
Brown 38, Princeton 31 — Johnny Pena scored on a 7-yard run with 57 seconds remaining and the Bears (3-2, 1-1 Ivy League) beat the Tigers (4-1, 1-1) in Providence, R.I.
Yale 21, Maine 10 — Deshawn Salter ran for 139 yards on 37 carries and two touchdowns to help lead the Bulldogs (4-1) to a come-from-behind nonconference victory over the Black Bears (2-4) in Orono, Maine.
William & Mary 34, UNH 18 — Kendell Anderson rushed for 174 yards and two touchdowns, leading the Tribe (4-2, 2-1) to a Colonial Athletic Association victory over the Wildcats (3-3, 1-1) in Williamsburg, Va.
Richmond 37, URI 12 — Kyle Lauletta threw for a career-high 312 yards and one score and ran for another to lead the Spiders (5-1, 3-0) to a CAA win over the Rams (1-6, 1-3) in Kingston, R.I.
Fordham 47, Holy Cross 41 — Chase Edmonds rushed for four touchdowns, including the game-winner in overtime, to lead the Rams (7-1, 1-0) to a Patriot League win over the Crusaders (2-4, 0-1) in the Bronx, N.Y.
Peter Pujals finished with 508 yards and four touchdowns for the Crusaders.
Bryant 38, Duquesne 17 — Dalton Easton threw for 330 yards and four touchdowns — each to a different receiver — as the Bulldogs (3-3, 1-1 Northeast) upended the Dukes (4-3, 1-1) in Smithfield, R.I.
Sacred Heart 31, Cornell 6 — Tyler Dube caught nine passes for 202 yards and a touchdown, an 80-yard fourth quarter strike from RJ Noel, to help lead the Pioneers (4-2) to a nonconference win over the Big Red (0-5) in Fairfield, Conn.
South Florida 28, UConn 20 — Quinton Flowers threw for 157 yards and two touchdowns and ran for 98 yards and another as the Bulls (3-3, 1-1 American Athletic Conference) beat the Huskies (3-4, 1-2) in East Hartford, Conn.
Bentley 10, AIC 6 — Linebacker Matt McDermott had two sacks, linebacker Craig Hanley of Walpole recovered a fumble and safety Sam McDonald of Norfolk had a critical late interception to help the Falcons (4-3, 4-2) limit the Yellow Jackets (3-4, 3-3) to 139 nets yards of offense in a Northeast-10 Conference win in Waltham.
Merrimack 41, Saint Anselm 16 — Nick Davis threw scoring strikes to Jere Brown and Cody Demers of Dracut as the Warriors (3-4, 3-3 NE-10) thumped the Hawks (2-5, 2-4) in North Andover. Adriell Mayes had touchdown runs of 1, 5 and 6 yards for Merrimack as Brown finished with 10 catches for 156 yards.
New Haven 28, Stonehill 14 — Ajee Patterson tossed a pair of touchdown passes as the Chargers (4-3, 4-2 NE-10) beat the Skyhawks (4-3, 3-3) in West Haven, Conn. Tewksbury’s Kevin Dick caught one of Matt Foltz’ two scoring passes for Stonehill.
Assumption 60, Southern Conn. State 50 — James Ward ran for 184 yards with a touchdown, Alex Shain gained 124 yards with three scores as the Greyhounds (6-1, 5-1 NE-10) outscored the Owls (2-6, 2-5) by a 29-15 margin in the fourth quarter in New Haven, Conn.
Trinity 34, Tufts 27 — Sonny Puzzo threw for 316 yards, including 25 on a touchdown pass to Bryan Vieira on the first play of the overtime period, as the Bantams (4-0) eked out a win against the Jumbos (3-1) in a NESCAC clash in Somerville.
Curry 20, Nichols 13 — Jordan Shairs of Gloucester galloped to 114 yards and Riley Cote passed for three touchdowns as the Colonels (2-4, 1-2 NEFC) topped the Bison (1-5, 0-3) in Milton.
